Class StringColouring

java.lang.Object
StringColouring
public class StringColouring extends Object
The class StringColouring contains a static method (function) for producing strings that can be printed in the console with colors. Several colors are availables as constants. These are defined in terms of ANSI Escape Codes for Text Color.

For example, to get "hello" that is printed in yellow in the console:

String s = toColoredString ("hello", StringColouring.YELLOW);

  • Method Details

    • toColoredString

      public static String toColoredString(String s, String color)
      Returns the string in the given color
      Parameters:
      s - the string to color
      color - the color to use, represented as an ANSI Escape Code
      Requires
      s != null && color != null
